text.text_translated:
In the last 200 years, technology and health got better.
Fewer children died young, so the number of people grew very fast.
Families were very large.
Their children grew up and had their own children.
But in the 1960s, more people could get contraception.
Contraception helps a woman to not have a baby.
Because of this, the average number of babies for each woman in the world went down.
It went down from six babies to just two.
